questions.answer_description: With AWS EC2, when a user is launching an instance he can select the availability zone (AZ. at the time of launch. questions.question_text: An organization has added 3 of his AWS accounts to consolidated billing. One of the AWS accounts has purchased a Reserved Instance (RI. of a small instance size in the US-East-1a zone. All other AWS accounts are running instances of a small size in the same zone. What will happen in this case for the RI pricing?
questions.answer_description:
AWS consolidated billing enables the organization to consolidate payments for multiple Amazon Web Services (AWS. accounts within a single organization by making a single paying account. For billing purposes, consolidated billing treats all the accounts on the consolidated bill as one account. This means that all accounts on a consolidated bill can receive the hourly cost benefit of the Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances purchased by any other account. In this case only one
Reserved Instance has been purchased by one account. Thus, only a single instance from any of the accounts will get the advantage of RI. AWS will implement the blended rate for each instance if more than one instance is running concurrently.

choices.C: Create 5 separate IAM users and set a different policy for their access
choices.D: Create 5 separate IAM groups and add users as per the department's employees
choices.B: Create 5 separate accounts and use the IAM cross account access with the roles for better management
choices.A: Create 5 separate accounts and make them a part of one consolidate billing

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
To achieve cost separation for each account and map it with the right cost center, the finance department can create separate AWS accounts for each department. By setting up a consolidated billing structure, the finance department can have a single paying account that is linked to all the other accounts.

Using IAM cross account access with roles, the finance department can grant appropriate permissions to each department's AWS account. This allows the departments to access and manage their own resources while maintaining centralized control over billing. The finance department can assign the appropriate cost center information to each account and easily track the costs associated with each department.

This approach provides better isolation, management, and cost separation between the different departments within the organization.
A. Create 5 separate accounts and make them a part of one consolidate billing
